website_summaries.verdict: Uses basic gears to move monkeys through the jungle. Manufacturer recommends this set for ages 4 and up, but most children under age 6 will need significant help to build.
pros: Comes with 136 pieces, including uniform-size plastic gears, connectors, crank, base plates, and monkeys
Use gears designs to make monkeys fly through the palm trees
Comes with step-by-step instructions but can also be used for free play
cons: Parent will need to do much of the setup for younger children

customer_reviews.title: This is an AWESOME toy! Keeps my younger kids busy for hours
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME toy! Keeps my younger kids busy for hours. We built the jungle exactly as pictured on the box and it works as described. The little monkeys are super cute. Pieces fit together easily and gears turn without a struggle. The kids are able to take everything apart and build their own jungles without a breaking the pieces or becoming frustrated they are stuck together. There are enough pieces in the set for them to play and build their own stuff without a fight over parts. Toy encourages imagination through engineering everything with the gears to move together. If you have kids under 5 I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: The Camps

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with product....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my four year old nephew and he loves it! I have been buying him the learning resources gears products for the past couple of years and adding to his collection. He is always playing and intermingling his gears and making what he likes to call his Gear cities. I have done a lot of research on toys and this has been an awesome find for me and my family. I definitely recommend purchasing the gears for your little ones because not only are they safe but a learning tool for them.
customer_reviews.author: BookButter

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining and Educational
customer_reviews.text: Children put their engineering skills to the test in a simply and entertaining way. This is a great addition to the gears set the I already have. The gears snap easily together and students can use their imagination to build exciting, spinning and rotating creations. They can also follow the instructions to create using a plan or just free-build. Either way there are hours of enjoyment from this product. The addition of the monkeys and vines really enhance the experience. Parts are durable and easy to use. With very little instruction even young children can begin to build.
customer_reviews.author: K. Callejas

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Toy
customer_reviews.text: A great toy for engaging young builders with inquisitive minds who need to know how things work. This toy may require adult assistance with the first set-up of the project but the young explore will soon put his own signature to the construction. Working with this toy may be made easier if the child has had the opportunity to play with the original Gears!, Gears! Gears! toys. I would feel confident In recommending this toy for any child 3 years and older
customer_reviews.author: Ann Armilio

customer_reviews.title: This is a great set, although the gears don't move effortlessly in ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set, although the gears don't move effortlessly in some areas. My grandson is young, but he loves monkeys, and sometimes will just play with them, or the palm trees, or just a small set-up of the gears, which is fine.
customer_reviews.author: TJL

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made toy with enough small parts to keep a child busy for a long time. It may need some adult help at first but children can soon build the things they think of on their own. I suggest not setting it up exactly as the directions and pictures indicate but letting the children find their own combination of "gear worlds".
customer_reviews.author: Laura K. Deblank

customer_reviews.title: Lots of frustration & limiting
customer_reviews.text: This Handle does not crank easily enough for an 8 year old to do. Parts pop off adding to the frustrating. Limited play because of this. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: so I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this! It isn't compatible with the Legos I'm familiar with. That was a little disappointing, but my grandson plays with this a lot, so I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Drool Bean

customer_reviews.title: Laughter and Cooperation!
customer_reviews.text: Grandsons ages 3, 6, 7 & 8 had such fun together. Good building going on!
customer_reviews.author: iamazing

customer_reviews.title: Many Tree Pieces
customer_reviews.text: The toy is about what I'd expected except for one thing: The trees/towers are made of many little pieces that are difficult for kids to put together. In fact they were difficult for adults to do. I'd suggest putting them together once and leaving them that way when packed up. Also, when I read how many pieces there were in different sets I didn't consider the fact that half the pieces in this set were tower structure as compared to base platforms, gears, and monkeys.
customer_reviews.author: jmwz23

customer_reviews.title: GREAT TOY!
customer_reviews.text: SUCH AN AWESOME TOY! We have two little girls (3 & 1) and they both love playing with this. It has a huge engineering/puzzle component that is great for my 3 year old. Daddy loves playing with this with them as well.
customer_reviews.author: JennReed16

customer_reviews.title: Birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this toy as a birthday gift for my 4 year old grandson and he called to thank me for the gift and he said that he loves it.My son said that he has played with it for hours at a time.He has already set it up in several different layouts.My sons only complaint is it really hurts when he step on one of the pieces when he is barefoot :)
customer_reviews.author: KJ James

customer_reviews.title: I bought this for my Great Niece for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my Great Niece for Christmas. The ability to put it together in so many different ways appeals to me. She will learn as she plays, and that is the best way to learn. If learning is not fun, you don't learn.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They don't hold his attention like the Lego Duplo or bristle blocks or tinker toys ...
customer_reviews.text: These are really neat but they are a little difficult to put together for my 3 year old nephew. If someone works with him he likes them. They don't hold his attention like the Lego Duplo or bristle blocks or tinker toys though.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Kielty

customer_reviews.title: It is stuck, so hard for gear moving smoothly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this gear set and set up exactly following the direction but the gears not moving smoothly as advertising in video , will return. disappointed
customer_reviews.author: KiWi

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened
customer_reviews.text: I know, everyone said that the parent will end up doing all of the work, but I held out hope that somehow my kids would sit down together and build this. But I was wrong. It really is a marvel once it is together, but I have wayyyy too much to do than sit for an hour putting this together, only to have it yanked apart. If you have a dedicated space to keep it together all of the time then that's great, but then again, how long can spinning monkeys hold a kids attention? I think I would have skipped this one.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Mom

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Snap Together
customer_reviews.text: This is a cute idea but it's not executed very well. The pieces are hard to snap together and take apart. It's very annoying. My kids still like playing with it but it doesn't work as smoothly as it should.
customer_reviews.author: One Clever Mommy

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy for children who like gears
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy for children who like gears. The monkey and vine add-ons provide some extra fun. Mom or dad will have to build it for preschoolers, but my son enjoys playing with the gears once we've set it up for him.
customer_reviews.author: Marie K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product!
customer_reviews.text: Gave these as a gift for my nephew's birthday. He won't leave the house without these gears. Terrific product!
customer_reviews.author: student63

customer_reviews.title: Challenging to assemble, frustrating for child to play
customer_reviews.text: It took several hours trying to build this up out of the hundred or so little pieces. Some were missing. It doesn't work the way we anticipated that it would, and that is most likely due to user error with assembly or the fact that it is missing a few pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm Jodi

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult. Only parents can do this. If ...
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult. Only parents can do this.If you want it to your child to be busy by himself - do not buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Very good boots

customer_reviews.title: One adult and two 7 years made a mess of ...
customer_reviews.text: One adult and two 7 years made a mess of this, never did get it together, children went off to video games after about 45 minues
customer_reviews.author: Freeman

customer_reviews.title: They are cool, Bright colors High-quality plastic The child is really
customer_reviews.text: They are cool, Bright colors High-quality plastic The child is really like
customer_reviews.author: Helena N.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. Fast shipment. It's been over a year now, and my 5 year old still loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Tonia J Benton-Wilson

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed in this product. My 3 year ok loves other gear sets and I assumed this would be similar. It took me 40 minutes to put it together, he can't do it himself. It only works one way! You can't change and rearrange it at all! Such a waste...
customer_reviews.author: zack kolbe

customer_reviews.title: Movin' Monkeys Gear Set
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our granddaughter. We helped her put it together and the fun began! This is a creative toy that provides lots of fun and laughing. Great toy!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine D. Heckler

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: The boys seemed to enjoy building with this set. The youngest likes to build and then knock it down...he had a hard time knocking this one down! LOL
customer_reviews.author: CLM

customer_reviews.title: Great cause & effect / chain reaction lesson
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loves it. Great cause & effect / chain reaction lesson
customer_reviews.author: Julie T

customer_reviews.title: Nice toy but not very good at setting it up
customer_reviews.text: My six year old and I (two college degrees) spent an hour trying to set it up and if you don't set it up perfectly it doesn't work to the optimal level of spinning monkeyness. Still a cool toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amy B.

customer_reviews.title: Monkeys moving
customer_reviews.text: We gave this to our grandson...parents had to help him put it together...too many pieces and he lost interest. Perhaps it should be for an older child but I don't see him playing with it often.
customer_reviews.author: Plain

customer_reviews.title: Gears, Gears, and more Gears
customer_reviews.text: I had bought one fo these for my grandson at a yard sale. It was missing some parts, but we all enjoyed putting it together. It is fun for all ages.
customer_reviews.author: Scarlett O'Hara

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A big hit with a 4 year old girl and her 6 year old brother.
customer_reviews.author: Redwood.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy
customer_reviews.text: Awesome toy, very few small pieces which I loved for my toddler. Not hard for my toddler to out together, highly recommend if you're looking at others as well
customer_reviews.author: Teagan

customer_reviews.title: Too tough for my grandsons ages 4 & 6
customer_reviews.text: My four y/o grandson loves to build and sat with me for more than an hour while "we" built something he could enjoy. He was fascinated with the gears that turned and turned, but really wanted to see the monkeys swing. We didn't get that far. I saw the box in the top of his closet when I visited this week. He clearly cannot do this on his own. I don't think he'll be ready for it until he is 8 or 9.
customer_reviews.author: Becky McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Gears! Gears! Gears! Movin Monkeys
customer_reviews.text: Love these, Grandkids, 5 year old boy & 7 year old girl spend hours playing with these. Great for the imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: My kids loved these.. 5 and 3 year old.. They pull them out almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: R. H.

customer_reviews.title: Fun & informative.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this toy for my 4 1/2 y.o. grandson. It was a bit of a challenge to assemble, but we did it together. He is very interested in how everything works together. The toy is durable and fun and really satisfies his mechanical nature.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hawes

customer_reviews.title: Fun Toy, Gear operation not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Assembly the gears per the configuration in the manual doesn't yield a very smooth operating machine. Disappointed in this for our child. Delivery.shipment was great, as expected...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hours of entertainment!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this toy! He plays with it every day. Even my 2.5 yr old loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Karyn johnson

customer_reviews.title: Impressed first-timer
customer_reviews.text: We've never owned "Gears" equipment before but bought this for our 6 year-old who is crazy about assembling blocks. He wasn't super-interested in building the model shown in the instructions, but has been assembling other things. My 8 year-old totally got into the model, though. He didn't need help interpreting the instructions but my 6 year-old did. Product is very durable and user friendly for small hands.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Hatch

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not very interesting once you open it. There are not many combination possible.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very colorful and cute, but is not working as promised
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I expected from the ad copy that the monkeys would travel around this piece. They don't. Some of them are attached to gears that cause a particular monkey to rotate around one piece, but that's as far as the "movin" goes. Also, the gears don't mesh well and lock up repeatedly. And since all of the gears are connected, it's almost impossible to identify exactly where the problem(s) is/are. Plus, young children can neither build this on their own nor trouble-shoot if it develops problems. I feel scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Mamalamadingdong

customer_reviews.title: Its good item, only bad part is hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: I like this item, my kid love this thing. only bad part is its had plastic. my kids hurt her hands while with this item. +ve its very nice item to play. -ve its hard plastic item. my kid hurts her hand while playing. -ve some items will broken very easily
customer_reviews.author: venkata

product_meta.title: Learning Resources Gears! Gears! Gears! Movin' Monkeys Building Play Set, 103 Pieces
product_meta.description:
Get your little engineer's creativity flowing and send these monkeys swinging through a jungle of gears. This jungle-themed construction set features palm-tree tops, gears, crank, connectors, base plates and monkey figurines—103 pieces total. Kids can use the easy-to-follow building instructions or create their own gears jungle.

AMAZON.COM
A variation of the award-winning Gears! Gears! Gears! construction set, Movin’ Monkeys adds a jungle theme to the building fun. Kids can follow the instructions and turn this set into the scene pictured on the box or can use their imaginations to create their own jungle setup. Monkeys hang from their hands or tail on the palm trees, vine, or each other and can even move down the length of a spiral building piece when the gears turn. Newcomers to these gear-shaped blocks may need to refer to instructions the first time they play with this toy—especially for details on how the palm trees fit together. The manufacturer’s targeted beginning age is four years old, but we recommend starting at six after observing younger children having difficulty constructing the palm trees and inadvertently knocking them over. The 103 pieces include the building platform, gears, cranks, palm tree components, vines, and monkeys. --Cristina Vaamonde

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
There's nothing like monk eying around to get creativity flowing! In this jungle-themed set, monkeys fly through the palm trees by their tails, then spin, twist and turn. Colorful set features plastic gears, crank, connectors and base plates for endless building possibilities. Kids develop their own gears jungle or use the easy-to-follow instructions. Includes 103 pieces. Ages 4 to 7

See more
feature_bullets: In this jungle-themed set, monkeys fly through the palm trees by their tails, then spin, twist and turn
Teach engineering and spatial concepts and let the creativity flow by building a monkey playland
Early STEM-supporting skills necessary to prepare children for future success
136-piece set features colorful plastic gears all uniform in size, connectors, crank, base plates, and monkeys
